name: Introduction to Film Studies
description: This course introduces students to the field of film studies, focusing on its history, genres, and techniques. Students will learn about the major filmmakers and movements in the history of film, and be able to identify and discuss the elements of a film.

name: Animation Basics
description: This course introduces students to basic animation techniques including drawing, design, and movement. Students will learn the fundamentals of animation and will be able to create simple animations using a variety of tools.

name: Intermediate Animation
description: This course builds on the basics of animation to introduce more advanced techniques such as character design, staging, and storyboarding. Students will learn how to create more complex animations and will be able to create animations with a distinct style and message.

name: Advanced Animation
description: This course is an advanced course in animation. Students will learn how to create realistic and stylized animation using advanced techniques such as 3D animation, motion capture, and effects. Students will also learn about the animation industry and how to use animation in storytelling.
